vstore.framework.context.types.noise

Class VNoise

  • java.lang.Object
    • vstore.framework.context.types.VContextType<VNoise>
      • vstore.framework.context.types.noise.VNoise
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class VNoise
extends VContextType<VNoise>
    This class represents an instance of the Noise context data.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static int DEFAULT_TRESHOLD_DB
      The default loudness threshold. 0dB is the loudest signal, -90.3dB is the lowest (this limitation comes from AWARE using 16Bit PCM for sampling).

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_TRESHOLD_DB

        public static final int DEFAULT_TRESHOLD_DB
        The default loudness threshold. 0dB is the loudest signal, -90.3dB is the lowest (this limitation comes from AWARE using 16Bit PCM for sampling).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • VNoise

        public VNoise(float db,
              float rms,
              int rmsThreshold,
              int dbThreshold,
              long timestamp)
        Create a new noise object. If you don't want to specify a timestamp, you can use the constructor VNoise(float, float, int, int)
        Parameters:
        db - Current noise in db.
        rms - Current noise rms. Currently not used.
        rmsThreshold - Currently not used.
        dbThreshold - If this value is crossed, noise will be considered as loud. A rock concert for example has around 115dB, a vacuum cleaner has 75dB and whispering has 30dB.
        timestamp - Timestamp of measurement in milliseconds

      • VNoise

        public VNoise(float db,
              float rms,
              int rmsThreshold,
              int dbThreshold)
        Creates a new noise object with the current system time unix timestamp.
        Parameters:
        db - Current noise in db. (From -90.3dB=lowest to 0dB=loudest)
        rms - Current noise rms.
        rmsThreshold - Currently not used.
        dbThreshold - If this value is crossed, noise will be considered as loud. 0dB is the loudest signal, and -90.3dB is the lowest (this limitation comes from AWARE using 16Bit PCM for sampling).

      • VNoise

        public VNoise(java.lang.String json)
       throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        Create a noise object from json string.
        Parameters:
        json - The json string.
        Throws:
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - in case the given JSON is malformed.

      • getDBThreshold

        public int getDBThreshold()

      • isSilent

        public boolean isSilent()
        If the measured dB value is higher than the dB threshold in this object, then noise is considered as loud. Possible scale is from -90.3dB = lowest to 0dB = loudest.
        Returns:
        True, if environment is silent for this context.

      • setDb

        public void setDb(float db)

      • setRMS

        public void setRMS(float rms)

      • setRMSThreshold

        public void setRMSThreshold(int rmsThresh)

      • setDbThreshold

        public void setDbThreshold(int dbThresh)
        Sets the dB threshold, that has to be crossed to treat the signal as loud. Possible scale is from -90.3dB = lowest to 0dB = loudest.
        Parameters:
        dbThresh - The threshold in dB.

      • getJson

        public org.json.simple.JSONObject getJson()
        Specified by:
        getJson in class VContextType<VNoise>
        Returns:
        This object as a JSON representation.

      • matches

        public boolean matches(VNoise other)
        Checks if the loudness in dB of the given noise context is over the dB threshold of this noise context.
        Specified by:
        matches in class VContextType<VNoise>
        Parameters:
        other - The other noise context to match against the threshold of this noise context.
        Returns:
        True, if the other noise context matches this one.
